00004 #include <config.h>
00005 #include <stdio.h>
00006 #include <bdd/util.h>

00008 
00009 /*  File   : getopt.c
00010  *  Author : Henry Spencer, University of Toronto
00011  *  Updated: 28 April 1984
00012  *
00013  *  Changes: (R Rudell)
00014  *      changed index() to strchr();
00015  *      added getopt_reset() to reset the getopt argument parsing
00016  *
00017  *  Purpose: get option letter from argv.
00018  */
00019 
00020 char *util_optarg;      /* Global argument pointer. */
00021 int util_optind = 0;    /* Global argv index. */
00022 static char *scan;
00023 
00024 
00025 void
00026 util_getopt_reset()
00027 {
00028     util_optarg = 0;
00029     util_optind = 0;
00030     scan = 0;
00031 }
00032 
00033 
00034 
00035 int 
00036 util_getopt(int argc, char *argv[], char *optstring)
00037 {
00038     register int c;
00039     register char *place;
00040 #if !defined(_IBMR2) && !defined(__cplusplus) && !defined(X86LIN_SOURCE) && !defined(IA64LIN_SOURCE)
00041     extern char *strchr();
00042 #endif
00043 
00044     util_optarg = NIL(char);
00045 
00046     if (scan == NIL(char) || *scan == '\0') {
00047         if (util_optind == 0) util_optind++;
00048         if (util_optind >= argc) return EOF;
00049         place = argv[util_optind];
00050         if (place[0] != '-' || place[1] == '\0') return EOF;
00051         util_optind++;
00052         if (place[1] == '-' && place[2] == '\0') return EOF;
00053         scan = place+1;
00054     }
00055 
00056     c = *scan++;
00057     place = strchr(optstring, c);
00058     if (place == NIL(char) || c == ':') {
00059         (void) fprintf(stderr, "%s: unknown option %c\n", argv[0], c);
00060         return '?';
00061     }
00062     if (*++place == ':') {
00063         if (*scan != '\0') {
00064             util_optarg = scan;
00065             scan = NIL(char);
00066         } else {
00067             if (util_optind >= argc) {
00068                 (void) fprintf(stderr, "%s: %c requires an argument\n", 
00069                     argv[0], c);
00070                 return '?';
00071             }
00072             util_optarg = argv[util_optind];
00073             util_optind++;
00074         }
00075     }
00076     return c;
00077 }
